text:
Geography. Bonds may be classified by the markers in which they are issued. Recall the
discussion in the previous topic review of domestic (or national) bond markets, foreign
bonds, and eurobonds, and the differences among them. Bond markets may also be
classified as developed markets or emerging markets. Emerging markets are countries
whose capital markets are less well-established than those in developed markets.
Emerging market bonds are typically viewed as riskier than developed market bonds and
therefore, have higher yields.
